div.p:
TheÂ missionÂ of the School District of Haverford Township is to educate and to inspire a community of lifelong learners.Â
Oakmont Administration Building
50 East Eagle Road
Havertown, PA 19083
610-853-5900

li.a: Belonging and Sociocultural Identities in Schools: BASIS
Sleep and Secondary School Start Times

div.p: The School District of HaverfordÂ Township is organized into departments that provide programs and services for students, parents, and employees.
The School District of Haverford Township offers many opportunities for students in academics, art and music, service organizations and athletics.
The School District of Haverford Township is governed by a nine-member school board. Each board member is elected to a four-year term of office and resides in the township.Â

li.a: We Need Your Help During COVID-19 Crisis
Why Is It Important To Update My Child's Emergency Information Form Every Year?
We Need Your Help During COVID-19 Crisis

div.p: Please see the attachedÂ Flexible Learning Guide for FamiliesÂ for specifics related to flexible learning.Â We will need parents' collaboration to assure students attendance and keeping up with their assignments and work.
The Flexible Learning: New Learning phaseÂ will shift the focus from skill review and practice, to moving forward with new learning.

li.p: All learning assignments will be posted via your childâ€™s learning platform on Fridays.Â

This does not preclude a teacher from posting daily communication in addition to the Friday post. However, we will be mindful of the number of emails sent and their impact on families with multiple students who have multiple teachers.
All learning assignments that are collected will be due no earlier than the following Sunday. Extensions will be granted on case by case basis and according to IEP and 504 accommodations.

Friday mornings will serve as a time for students to â€œcatch upâ€ on the weekâ€™s work. After noon on Friday, we invite the entire district and community to engage in mindfulness and wellness practices that will support emotional and social well being. For ideas and resources, visit the counselor and nurse websites.Â

div.p: Students who have internet access are also welcome to use the online resources already available to them such as Study Island, Reflex Math, and RAZ Kids. Other interesting ideas are available at sites like those listed below.

Our district buses will be in the following locations and times with our teachers to help distribute lunches. Tuesday includes breakfast and lunch for two days and Thursday includes breakfast and lunch for three days. If you have any issues please call the transportation department at 610-853-5929.Â

tr.td: Old LA Fitness W Chester Pike

ul.li:
At-home technology assistance:
Email:Â ITHelpdesk@haverfordsd.net
Call:Â 610-853-5951 and leave a messageÂ
Devices can be wiped down with a semi-moist Clorox wipe. Wipes should be rung out so they are not too damp.Â
In the absence of a wipe, a paper towel can be sprayed with a disinfectant and then used to wipe the device, again, making sure that the towel is not too moist.Â
Nothing should be sprayed directly onto devices.

div.div: THE SCHOOL DISTRICT OF HAVERFORD TOWNSHIP
